definition: everywhere/all over/classifier for actions: one time

sentences.english: It's great that we're seeing such community spirit sweeping the nation.

sentences.english: It has multiple regions that include dozens if not hundreds of branches.

sentences.english: We have targeted two principal market sectors with our equipment: agriculture and light industrial construction applications worldwide.

sentences.chinese: 你是遍及所有的精神，但我却朝拜圣地。

sentences.chinese: 我们的销售以及服务体系遍及全国，使您无后顾之忧。

During his lifetime, Xu Xiahe visited 16 provinces, leaving his footsteps everywhere across the land.

sentences.english: There were many famous porcelain kilns at the time; each different kiln system produced varied styles of work.

definition: to cover the whole (area)/to be found throughout
and even/to go so far as to
to make a name/to become famous
domestic and international/at home and abroad
to go everywhere/to scour (the whole town)
north and south sides of the Yangtze River (idiom)/(fig.) all over China
all over the world/everywhere/in all parts of the world
to count as number one (idiom); second to none/outstanding
